Funny fact about ammonia. In Russia, if you want to buy ammonia in a regular pharmacy, the seller may refuse to sell more than 1-2 bottles of 40ml (10% concentration). Because ammonia can be used in the production of drugs.
However, if you go to the store for chemists, you will easily sell a few liters of ammonia (25% concentration).
Though, I would assume you would need a license and a background check, if not openly then secretly.
Nope. Just go to store for chemists and by as much as you want. The minimum purchase volume is 1 liter.
Note to self...need ammonia go to Russia.
I'm pretty sure, in your country, you can also buy ammonia.
Probably...though I bet in the US there are higher restrictions.
Maybe. But as far as I know in the US, radioactive materials are easier to buy than in Russia.
I know a few people that actually bought ammonia to make bombs, small ones, for fun. They had a hell of a time buying enough without getting asked why.
I am pretty sure though, unless you have a license and a known reason, you cannot purchase enough ammonia to make a large bomb.
There‚Äôs a thing some do that‚Äôs a sprinkle of salt and then cover it with an ice cube on your arm

About radioactive materials. Once I tried to officially buy a radioactive source. To do this, you need a lot of licenses, approvals and other bureaucratic things.
I assume the same here in the US for specific radioactive materials.
Probably pick up a home laboratory like this https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RKyIm-o30GE not possible in Russia
But I solved the problem simply. I can not buy a source officially. For that I can go to a neighboring town and dig up the earth in the courtyard of an ordinary apartment house.
I don't know why but that amuses my, notably prejudice, view of Russia.
I would never actually follow said prejudice, but it just seems funny.
